comments.author: Daniel Delgado

comments.comment: I don't understand this. Why we reset this after populated?

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Reset can be a bad name, but is to reset the selected field. We populate the list for the selection and then set, or not, the default value. In a cascading load we need to change the default, but if we are resuming the step, and we have those values previously selected, we cannot change this selection that is made in the init.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
FINEOS coding guidelines indicates one return statement per method. Update existing breakages of this in this file (there are 4 breakages of this rule). you may not agree, but this is in the guidelines:
4.2.4 Method Return Statements No more than one return in a method.
